mapper.select: select * from department order by id
select b.* from (select distinct department_id from evaluate_task_participant where police_id=#{policeId} and type=1 and task_id=#{taskId}) as a left join department b on b.id=a.department_id

select id,name from department where 1 =1
and FIND_IN_SET(id, #{ids})
select * from department where id = (select department_id from user where police_id = #{policeId})
select b.name,b.id from leave_power a left join department b on find_in_set(b.id,a.department_object_ids) > 0 where a.checker_id=#{policeId} and b.id is not null order by b.id desc
select b.name,b.id from leave_power a left join department b on find_in_set(b.id,a.department_object_ids) > 0 where a.checker_id=#{policeId} and b.id is not null order by b.id desc
select d.id as deptId, d.`name` as deptName, count(u.police_id) as policeCount from department d left join user u on d.id = u.department_id GROUP BY d.id, d.name

SELECT d.NAME deptName, ifnull( r2.count, 0 ) countNum FROM department d LEFT JOIN ( SELECT r1.department_id, count( r1.department_id ) count FROM ( SELECT u.department_id FROM publicity_info pi LEFT JOIN publicity_user_info pui ON pi.id = pui.info_id LEFT JOIN user u ON pui.police_id = u.police_id GROUP BY pui.info_id, u.department_id ) r1 GROUP BY r1.department_id ) r2 ON d.id = r2.department_id ORDER BY r2.count DESC LIMIT 5
